Welcome to covid-19-dashboard’s documentation!¶

covid_data_handler.FORMAT = '%(levelname)s: %(asctime)s %(message)s'¶

This is the format the logs will be displayed in the log-file

covid_data_handler.covid_API_request(location='Exeter', location_type='ltla')¶

This function uses an API to return up to date covid data. It takes the location and location type of the area that the covid data is for, these are deafultly set to the location and location type stored in the configuration file

covid_data_handler.covid_api = {'location': 'Exeter', 'location_type': 'ltla'}¶

Assigns a variable to the apropriate ###### for this program

covid_data_handler.parse_csv_data(csv_filename=<class 'str'>)¶

This function takes a csv file and returns a list of strings for the rows of the file

covid_data_handler.process_covid_csv_data(covid_csv_data)¶

This function takes in a list as an argument(in this case the list returned from parse_csv_data and returns the the number of cases in the last 7 days, the current number of hospital cases and the cumulative number of deaths as contained in the csv file that parse_csv_data returns as a list

covid_data_handler.s = <sched.scheduler object>¶

Calling sched and assigning it to a variable

covid_data_handler.second_calculator(hour_minute)¶

Function used to calculate the seconds until the time given in the format HH:MM(hours and minutes)

covid_news_handling.FORMAT = '%(levelname)s: %(asctime)s %(message)s'¶

This is the format the logs will be displayed in the log-file

covid_news_handling.news = []¶

Creates a list called news that will be used to store and display the news storries

covid_news_handling.news_API_request(covid_terms='Covid COVID-19 coronavirus')¶

This function uses an API to retrieve news articles with the relevant terms currently these terms are accesssed from the config file

covid_news_handling.news_api = {'api_key': '7ae699a798ac44d9b7f3665d19fe621a', 'base_url': 'https://newsapi.org/v2/everything?', 'covid_terms': 'Covid COVID-19 coronavirus'}¶

Opens the configuration file and assigns it
